We had a wonderful and busy week last week!
Thank you to NPHS for organizing a fantastic Fall Mixer fundraiser and to all the families who came together to support the Hurley. It was heartwarming to see both new and returning families connect and build community. Our assemblies also went beautifully, celebrating multiculturalism, LGBTQ+ history, and student achievements. Special thanks to the staff who made these events so meaningful and memorable. These moments truly show the strength of our community.
Looking ahead, Halloween will be observed on Thursday, October 31st. Although Boston Public Schools does not consider Halloween a religious holiday, we understand that some families may not participate. If you have any concerns, please reach out to your child‚Äôs teacher.
Please review the full set of guidelines by referring to theHurley K-8 Halloween Guidelines Document. A few important things to know for Halloween:
Costumes:
Students must arrive at school already dressed in their costumes‚Äîno changing at school.
Costumes should allow for safe movement and participation in PE and recess. Inflatable or bulky costumes are not allowed.
Costumes should be fun and positive, without violent, scary, or offensive themes.
Masks, toy weapons, and face paint that makes students unrecognizable are not permitted.
Please ensure footwear is safe for outdoor play and emergencies.
Food Policy:
No candy or treats are allowed in the classrooms.
Any food donations must be coordinated with teachers and properly labeled.
Any food brought to school without coordination will be returned to families in order to ensure adherence to safety guidelines.
We encourage non-food items like stickers, pencils, or erasers to mark the occasion.
I am also excited to announce that, for the first time, we have a School Site Council with student representatives from grades 4-8! Mr. P and I met with these students last week to set up their meeting schedule for the term, which runs through February. Our first meeting will take place this Wednesday during lunch, and don‚Äôt worry‚Äîno one will miss recess üòâ! I can‚Äôt wait to see the leadership and ideas they bring to the table.
Thank you for your continued support, and I look forward to another great week with our Hurley community!
Con cari√±o,
Ms. Verano
Principal / Directora
